content: end up with a pentagon instead you should always have 6 sides and 6 corners after each round to size your cardigan you will need a tape measure and another cardigan or jacket that fits you well it does not have to be exact just an estimate since this is an oversized cardigan i laid the jacket flat with arms out and front zipped up i took 2 measurements the width of the back starting under the arms at one arm pit and measuring across the back to the other the next i measured from top shoulder where the neckline starts down the front to the bottom edge to get the length if you don t have anything to measure you can measure yourself and use half of your bust size stand straight and relaxed measure loosely around your chest at the widest point and divide by 2 if you do decide to change/alter your cardigan in length or width please be sure to repeat the same changes on second hexagon so both sides end up even you will have a lot of ends to weave especially if you plan on changing colors every row you can weave them in as you go or wait until the end i chose to stop and weave in ends after each stage of the pattern so i wouldn t be so overwhelmed with the weaving them all at the end if you are using just one main color and one accent color you can keep the yarn attached as you crochet for instance the example used in this pattern the main color is black and many accent colors i kept the black yarn attached and brought it up on the ws of my work this will ensure that any differences will only be visible on the inside of the cardigan 4 main body hexagon -
